newsitem.title: CHINA: Changhong sales hit $1.29 bln in '96.
newsitem.headline: Changhong sales hit $1.29 bln in '96.

text.p: Chinese television maker Sichuan Changhong Electric Appliances Co Ltd saw sales of 10.7 billion yuan ($1.29 billion) in 1996, becoming China's top electronics firm in terms of turnover, the China Daily said on Thursday.
Computer firm Legend Group was second on the list with sales of 7.74 billion yuan, the newspaper said. Legend has a Hong Kong listed arm, Legend Holdings Ltd (Hong Kong).
Cai Hong Display Devices Co Ltd, a television tube and set maker, notched up sales of 6.3 billion yuan, ranking it third, the newspaper said.
The combined sales of the top 100 electronics firms reached 149 billion yuan last year, an increase of 21 percent from the year before, it said.
Combined sales of the top 10 companies accounted for 30 percent of the total, it said.
Some 40 firms chalked up sales of more than one billion yuan each in 1996, seven more than in the previous year, it said.

State-owned firms accounted for 49 of the top 100, while 21 were Sino-foreign joint ventures in which the Chinese side had a majority stake, and 19 were joint-stock companies, it said but gave no further details.
